TITLE: Initializing BeautifulSoup Object in Python DESCRIPTION: These examples show how to create a BeautifulSoup object from either a file or a string containing HTML. The soup object is the starting point for parsing and navigating the document. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from bs4 import BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(open("index.html")) soup = BeautifulSoup("data") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing HTML with BeautifulSoup in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a BeautifulSoup object by parsing an HTML document and then pretty-print the parsed structure. It requires the bs4 module to be imported. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` from bs4 import BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_doc) print(soup.prettify()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating BeautifulSoup Object from HTML Document (Python) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to initialize a BeautifulSoup object with an HTML document containing a story about three sisters. The example demonstrates parsing and pretty printing of the document structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` html_doc = """ The Dormouse's story

The Dormouse's story

Once upon a time there were three little sisters; and their names were Elsie, Lacie and Tillie; and they lived at the bottom of a well.

...

""" from bs4 import BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_doc) print(soup.prettify()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Extracting Text Content from HTML Document (Python) DESCRIPTION: Shows how to extract all text content from a parsed HTML document using BeautifulSoup's get_text() method. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` print(soup.get_text()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Finding All Tags Using BeautifulSoup in Python DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the find_all() method to retrieve all tags from a BeautifulSoup object. This allows for more complex searching beyond just finding the first occurrence of a tag. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all('a') # [Elsie, # Lacie, # Tillie] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Extracting URLs from Tags with BeautifulSoup in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to extract all URLs found within tags on a page using BeautifulSoup. It uses a for loop to iterate through all 'a' elements and print their 'href' attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` for link in soup.find_all('a'): print(link.get('href')) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Extracting All Text from HTML with BeautifulSoup in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to extract all text content from an HTML page using BeautifulSoup's get_text() method. It removes all HTML tags and returns only the textual content. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` print(soup.get_text()) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Extracting URLs from HTML Document (Python) DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to extract all URLs from tags in a parsed HTML document using BeautifulSoup's find_all() method. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` for link in soup.find_all('a'): print(link.get('href')) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Element Search with find_all() in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Shows the simplest usage of find_all() to search for specific HTML tags by name in the document tree. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_31 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all('b') # [The Dormouse's story] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up HTML Document Parsing with BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to initialize BeautifulSoup with an HTML document string for parsing and searching through the document tree. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_30 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` html_doc = """ The Dormouse's story

The Dormouse's story

Once upon a time there were three little sisters; and their names were Elsie, Lacie and Tillie; and they lived at the bottom of a well.

...

""" from bs4 import BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_doc) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Searching Elements with Multiple CSS Classes in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates searching for elements with specific CSS classes. It shows how BeautifulSoup matches against any of the CSS classes in a multi-class element. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_42 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` css_soup = BeautifulSoup('

') css_soup.find_all("p", class_="strikeout") # [

] css_soup.find_all("p", class_="body") # [

] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing and Modifying Tag Attributes in BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to access and modify attributes of a tag object in BeautifulSoup. It shows dictionary-style access to attributes and methods for adding, modifying, and removing attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` tag['class'] = 'verybold' tag['id'] = 1 tag #
Extremely bold
del tag['class'] del tag['id'] tag #
Extremely bold
tag['class'] # KeyError: 'class' print(tag.get('class')) # None ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Navigating BeautifulSoup Object in Python DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows various ways to navigate the BeautifulSoup object, including accessing tags, attributes, and nested elements. It demonstrates basic operations like finding elements and extracting text content. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` soup.title soup.title.name soup.title.string soup.title.parent.name soup.p soup.p['class'] soup.a soup.find_all('a') soup.find(id="link3") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Elements with Custom Functions in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create and use custom filter functions that apply specific logic to select elements based on multiple conditions. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_35 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` def has_class_but_no_id(tag): return tag.has_attr('class') and not tag.has_attr('id') soup.find_all(has_class_but_no_id) # [

The Dormouse's story

, #

Once upon a time there were...

, #

...

] ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from bs4 import NavigableString def surrounded_by_strings(tag): return (isinstance(tag.next_element, NavigableString) and isinstance(tag.previous_element, NavigableString)) for tag in soup.find_all(surrounded_by_strings): print tag.name # p # a # a # a # p ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Navigating the Parse Tree in BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: These examples show how to navigate the parsed HTML tree using tag names as attributes. This allows for quick access to specific elements in the document structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.head # The Dormouse's story soup.title # The Dormouse's story soup.body.b # The Dormouse's story soup.a # Elsie ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering by Attribute Values in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Shows different ways to filter elements based on their attribute values using keyword arguments, regular expressions, and boolean conditions. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_37 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all(id='link2') # [Lacie] ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all(href=re.compile("elsie")) # [Elsie] ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all(id=True) # [Elsie, # Lacie, # Tillie] ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all(href=re.compile("elsie"), id='link1') # [three] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Selecting Elements by ID in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to select elements by their ID attribute using the # notation or by combining element type with ID. This provides a way to directly target specific elements. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_64 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.select("#link1") # [Elsie] soup.select("a#link2") # [Lacie] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Searching by CSS Class with Regular Expressions in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to search for elements using regular expressions on CSS class names. It uses the re.compile function to match any class containing 'itl'. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_40 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all(class_=re.compile("itl")) # [

The Dormouse's story

] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Advanced Filtering with find_all() in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates various ways to use find_all() with different types of filters including tag names, classes, and attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_36 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all("title") # [The Dormouse's story] soup.find_all("p", "title") # [

The Dormouse's story

] soup.find_all("a") # [Elsie, # Lacie, # Tillie] soup.find_all(id="link2") # [Lacie] import re soup.find(text=re.compile("sisters")) # u'Once upon a time there were three little sisters; and their names were\n' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Selecting Elements by CSS Class in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to select elements by their CSS class using the dot notation or attribute selector. This is useful for finding all elements with a specific class across the document. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_63 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.select(".sister") # [Elsie, # Lacie, # Tillie] soup.select("[class~=sister]") # [Elsie, # Lacie, # Tillie] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Selecting Elements by Attribute Value in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates various ways to select elements based on attribute values using different matching operators. These methods allow for exact, prefix, suffix, and substring matching. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_66 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.select('a[href="http://example.com/elsie"]') # [Elsie] soup.select('a[href^="http://example.com/"]') # [Elsie, # Lacie, # Tillie] soup.select('a[href$="tillie"]') # [Tillie] soup.select('a[href*=".com/el"]') # [Elsie] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using find() to Get a Single Result in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the find() method, which returns only the first matching element rather than a list. It's more efficient than using find_all() with limit=1. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_52 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all('title', limit=1) # [The Dormouse's story] soup.find('title') # The Dormouse's story print(soup.find("nosuchtag")) # None ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Chaining find() Method Calls in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to chain find() method calls to navigate through nested elements, which is equivalent to using tag name navigation. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_53 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.head.title # The Dormouse's story soup.find("head").find("title") # The Dormouse's story ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Navigating Between Siblings with next_sibling and previous_sibling in BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to navigate between elements at the same level (siblings) using the .next_sibling and .previous_sibling attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_22 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` sibling_soup.b.next_sibling # text2 sibling_soup.c.previous_sibling # text1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using CSS Selectors in BeautifulSoup4 with Python DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use CSS selectors with BeautifulSoup4's select() method to find elements using CSS patterns. This provides a powerful way to navigate the document using familiar CSS selector syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_60 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.select("title") # [The Dormouse's story] soup.select("p nth-of-type(3)") # [

...

] soup.select("body a") # [Elsie, # Lacie, # Tillie] soup.select("html head title") # [The Dormouse's story] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Custom Functions for Text Selection in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use a custom function with the text parameter to find strings that are the only children of their parent tags. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_47 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` def is_the_only_string_within_a_tag(s): """Return True if this string is the only child of its parent tag.""" return (s == s.parent.string) soup.find_all(text=is_the_only_string_within_a_tag) # [u"The Dormouse's story", u"The Dormouse's story", u'Elsie', u'Lacie', u'Tillie', u'...'] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Iterating Through Elements with next_elements in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the next_elements iterator to traverse through all subsequent elements in the document from a given starting point. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_29 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` for element in last_a_tag.next_elements: print(repr(element)) # u'Tillie' # u';\nand they lived at the bottom of a well.' # u'\n\n' #

...

# u'...' # u'\n' # None ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Searching by CSS Class in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to search for elements with specific CSS classes using the class_ keyword argument, which handles Python's reserved word problem. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_39 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all("a", class_="sister") # [Elsie, # Lacie, # Tillie] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using extract() Method in Beautiful Soup 4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to remove an element from the parse tree and return it using the extract() method. The extracted element becomes the root of its own parse tree. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_77 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` markup = 'I linked to example.com' soup = BeautifulSoup(markup) a_tag = soup.a i_tag = soup.i.extract() a_tag # I linked to i_tag # example.com print(i_tag.parent) None my_string = i_tag.string.extract() my_string # u'example.com' print(my_string.parent) # None i_tag # ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Data Attributes in BeautifulSoup4 Searches DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to search for elements with HTML5 data attributes by using the attrs parameter with a dictionary of attribute pairs. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_38 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` data_soup = BeautifulSoup('
foo!
') data_soup.find_all(attrs={"data-foo": "value"}) # [
foo!
] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Extracting Text Content with get_text() in BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the get_text() method in BeautifulSoup to extract all text content from a document or specific tag. It shows different options for joining text fragments and handling whitespace. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_87 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` markup = '\nI linked to example.com\n' soup = BeautifulSoup(markup) soup.get_text() u'\nI linked to example.com\n' soup.i.get_text() u'example.com' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Multiple Strings with .strings Generator in BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: Shows how to iterate over all strings contained in a tag and its descendants using the .strings generator, which preserves all whitespace. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` for string in soup.strings: print(repr(string)) # u"The Dormouse's story" # u'\n\n' # u"The Dormouse's story" # u'\n\n' # u'Once upon a time there were three little sisters; and their names were\n' # u'Elsie' # u',\n' # u'Lacie' # u' and\n' # u'Tillie' # u';\nand they lived at the bottom of a well.' # u'\n\n' # u'...' # u'\n' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Tag Contents in BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the .contents attribute to access a tag's direct children as a list. This example retrieves the contents of the head tag, which contains a title tag. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` head_tag = soup.head head_tag # The Dormouse's story head_tag.contents [The Dormouse's story] title_tag = head_tag.contents[0] title_tag # The Dormouse's story title_tag.contents # [u'The Dormouse's story'] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Searching for Text Content in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates using the text parameter to search for specific text content within a document, including exact string matching, lists of strings, and regex patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_46 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all(text="Elsie") # [u'Elsie'] soup.find_all(text=["Tillie", "Elsie", "Lacie"]) # [u'Elsie', u'Lacie', u'Tillie'] soup.find_all(text=re.compile("Dormouse")) [u"The Dormouse's story", u"The Dormouse's story"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Parsing XML with BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to parse XML documents using BeautifulSoup4 by passing 'xml' as the parser argument. Requires lxml to be installed. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_97 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup = BeautifulSoup(markup, "xml") ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Recursive Iteration with .descendants in BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using the .descendants attribute to recursively iterate over all of a tag's children, including direct children and their children at all levels. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` for child in head_tag.descendants: print(child) # The Dormouse's story # The Dormouse's story ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using CSS Selectors for Multiple Class Matching in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates using the select() method with CSS selectors to find elements that match multiple CSS classes, regardless of their order in the class attribute. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_44 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` css_soup.select("p.strikeout.body") # [

] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Iterating Over Tag Children with .children Generator in BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: Shows how to iterate over a tag's direct children using the .children generator instead of accessing them as a list with .contents. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` for child in title_tag.children: print(child) # The Dormouse's story ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Controlling Search Depth with the recursive Parameter in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates using the recursive parameter to control whether find_all() searches through all descendants or only direct children of an element. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_50 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.html.find_all("title") # [The Dormouse's story] soup.html.find_all("title", recursive=False) # [] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modifying Tag Names and Attributes in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to rename tags and modify their attributes. This allows for changing the structure and properties of HTML/XML elements in the document tree. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_68 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup = BeautifulSoup('Extremely bold') tag = soup.b tag.name = "blockquote" tag['class'] = 'verybold' tag['id'] = 1 tag #
Extremely bold
del tag['class'] del tag['id'] tag #
Extremely bold
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing String Content with .string in BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to access a tag's string content using the .string attribute. This works when a tag has only one child that is a NavigableString or if its only child tag has a .string. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` title_tag.string # u'The Dormouse's story' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Sibling CSS Selectors in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use sibling combinators (~ and +) in CSS selectors to find elements that are siblings of other elements. The ~ combinator finds all following siblings while + finds only the next sibling. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_62 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.select("#link1 ~ .sister") # [Lacie, # Tillie] soup.select("#link1 + .sister") # [Lacie] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modifying Element Content in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to change the content of an element by setting its .string attribute. This replaces all existing content with the new string, removing any nested elements. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_69 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` markup = 'I linked to example.com' soup = BeautifulSoup(markup) tag = soup.a tag.string = "New link text." tag # New link text. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Element Siblings with next_element and previous_element in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to navigate between adjacent elements in the parse tree using next_element and previous_element attributes to move forward and backward through the document as it was parsed. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_28 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` last_a_tag.next_element # u'Tillie' ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` last_a_tag.previous_element # u' and\n' last_a_tag.previous_element.next_element # Tillie ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Finding All Tags with True Filter in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to find all tags in the document by passing True as the filter to find_all(), which matches any tag but not text strings. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_34 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` for tag in soup.find_all(True): print(tag.name) # html # head # title # body # p # b # p # a # a # a # p ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Appending Content to Elements in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to add content to an existing element using the append() method. This allows for incrementally building element content without replacing existing content. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_70 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup = BeautifulSoup("Foo") soup.a.append("Bar") soup # FooBar soup.a.contents # [u'Foo', u'Bar'] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating New Tags in Beautiful Soup 4 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to create new HTML tags using BeautifulSoup's new_tag() factory method. Demonstrates creating a tag with attributes, appending it to an existing tag, and setting its string content. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_73 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup = BeautifulSoup("") original_tag = soup.b new_tag = soup.new_tag("a", href="http://www.example.com") original_tag.append(new_tag) original_tag # new_tag.string = "Link text." original_tag # Link text. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Alternative Way to Search by Class Using attrs Parameter in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to search for elements by class using the attrs parameter, which is useful for older versions of BeautifulSoup that don't have the class_ shortcut. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_45 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all("a", attrs={"class": "sister"}) # [Elsie, # Lacie, # Tillie] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Searching Elements with Regular Expressions in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using regular expressions with find_all() to match tag names based on patterns rather than exact strings. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_32 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` import re for tag in soup.find_all(re.compile("^b")): print(tag.name) # body # b ``` LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` for tag in soup.find_all(re.compile("t")): print(tag.name) # html # title ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using insert_before() and insert_after() in Beautiful Soup 4 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to insert elements before or after specific elements in the parse tree using insert_before() and insert_after() methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_75 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup = BeautifulSoup("stop") tag = soup.new_tag("i") tag.string = "Don't" soup.b.string.insert_before(tag) soup.b # Don'tstop soup.b.i.insert_after(soup.new_string(" ever ")) soup.b # Don't ever stop soup.b.contents # [Don't, u' ever ', u'stop'] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Limiting Search Results in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the limit parameter to restrict the number of results returned by find_all(), which can improve performance for large documents. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_49 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` soup.find_all("a", limit=2) # [Elsie, # Lacie] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Combining Tag and Text Searches in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates combining tag and text searches to find specific tags that contain specific text content. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_93 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` snowmen = (u"\N{SNOWMAN}" * 3) quote = (u"\N{LEFT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK}I like snowmen!\N{RIGHT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK}") doc = snowmen.encode("utf8") + quote.encode("windows_1252") print(doc) # I like snowmen! print(doc.decode("windows-1252")) # "I like snowmen!" new_doc = UnicodeDammit.detwingle(doc) print(new_doc.decode("utf8")) # "I like snowmen!" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using unwrap() Method in Beautiful Soup 4 DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to replace a tag with its contents using the unwrap() method, effectively removing the tag while preserving its contents. Returns the tag that was unwrapped. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_81 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` markup = 'I linked to example.com' soup = BeautifulSoup(markup) a_tag = soup.a a_tag.i.unwrap() a_tag # I linked to example.com ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Encoding HTML Tags with Unicode Characters in Python DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how Beautiful Soup handles encoding of HTML tags containing Unicode characters for different encodings (UTF-8, Latin-1, ASCII). SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_90 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` print(tag.encode("utf-8")) # print tag.encode("latin-1") # ☃ print tag.encode("ascii") # ☃ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: BeautifulSoup4 Import Statement DESCRIPTION: Example showing the new import syntax for BeautifulSoup4, demonstrating the change from the old 'BeautifulSoup' module name to the new 'bs4' module name. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/NEWS.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` from bs4 import BeautifulSoup ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Strings with Whitespace Stripped in BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates using the .stripped_strings generator to iterate over strings with whitespace removed from beginning and end, and with whitespace-only strings ignored. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_16 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` for string in soup.stripped_strings: print(repr(string)) # u"The Dormouse's story" # u"The Dormouse's story" # u'Once upon a time there were three little sisters; and their names were' # u'Elsie' # u',' # u'Lacie' # u'and' # u'Tillie' # u';\nand they lived at the bottom of a well.' # u'...' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Custom HTML Entity Formatter in Python with BeautifulSoup DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a custom formatter function for BeautifulSoup that both converts text to uppercase and substitutes characters with HTML entities. The custom formatter is then applied to the prettify() method to format the output. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_85 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from bs4.dammit import EntitySubstitution def uppercase_and_substitute_html_entities(str): return EntitySubstitution.substitute_html(str.upper()) print(soup.prettify(formatter=uppercase_and_substitute_html_entities)) # # #

# IL A DIT <<SACRÉ BLEU!>> #

# # ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using CData Objects with BeautifulSoup in Python DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to create a CData object with BeautifulSoup, which preserves the exact content without any formatting. The code demonstrates that even when using a formatter, the content inside a CData object remains unaltered. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_86 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` from bs4.element import CData soup = BeautifulSoup("") soup.a.string = CData("one < three") print(soup.a.prettify(formatter="xml")) # # # ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using prettify() for Formatted Output in Beautiful Soup 4 DESCRIPTION: Shows how to generate a nicely formatted representation of the parse tree using the prettify() method, with each HTML/XML tag on its own line. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_82 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` markup = 'I linked to example.com' soup = BeautifulSoup(markup) soup.prettify() # '\n \n \n \n \n...' print(soup.prettify()) # # # # # # I linked to # # example.com # # # # print(soup.a.prettify()) # # I linked to # # example.com # # ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: BeautifulSoup Generator Usage Example DESCRIPTION: Shows the syntax for using BeautifulSoup parent generators, comparing old and new styles. The new style uses properties instead of generator methods. SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_43 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` css_soup.find_all("p", class_="body strikeout") # [

] css_soup.find_all("p", class_="strikeout body") # [] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Filtering Elements by CSS Class Length in BeautifulSoup4 DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use a custom function as a filter for find_all(). SOURCE: https://github.com/wention/beautifulsoup4/blob/master/doc/source/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_41 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` def has_six_characters(css_class): return css_class is not None and len(css_class) == 6 soup.find_all(class_=has_six_characters) # [Elsie, # Lacie, # Tillie] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: BeautifulSoup3 to BeautifulSoup4 Import Migration DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to update import statements when migrating from BS3 to BS4.
